00025 #include "OgreDataChunk.h"
00026 #include "OgreException.h"
00027 
00028 namespace Ogre {
00029 
00030     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00031     DataChunk::DataChunk()
00032         : mData( NULL ), mSize( 0 )
00033     {
00034     }
00035 
00036     DataChunk::DataChunk( void *pData, size_t size )
00037     {
00038         mData = reinterpret_cast< uchar* >( pData );
00039         mEnd = mData + size;
00040         mPos = mData;
00041         mSize = size;
00042     }
00043 
00044     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00045     uchar* DataChunk::allocate( size_t size, uchar * ptr )
00046     {
00047         assert (size > 0);
00048 
00049         if( mData )
00050             delete [] mData;
00051 
00052         mData = new uchar[size];
00053         mSize = size;
00054         mPos = mData;
00055         mEnd = mData + size;
00056 
00057         if( ptr )
00058             memcpy( mData, ptr, mSize );
00059 
00060         return mData;
00061     }
00062 
00063     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00064     DataChunk & DataChunk::clear(void)
00065     {
00066         if (mData)
00067         {
00068             delete [] mData;
00069             mData = 0;
00070             mSize = 0;
00071         }
00072 
00073         return *this;
00074     }
00075     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00076     size_t DataChunk::getSize(void) const
00077     {
00078         return mSize;
00079     }
00080 
00081     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00082     uchar * DataChunk::getPtr(void)
00083     {
00084         return mData;
00085     }
00086 
00087     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00088     const uchar * DataChunk::getPtr() const
00089     {
00090         return mData;
00091     }
00092 
00093     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00094     ulong DataChunk::read(void* buffer, ulong size)
00095     {
00096         ulong cnt = size;
00097         // Read over end of memory?
00098         if (mPos + size > mEnd)
00099             cnt = mEnd - mPos;
00100         if (cnt == 0)
00101             return 0;
00102 
00103         memcpy(buffer, (const void*)mPos, cnt);
00104         mPos += cnt;
00105         return cnt;
00106     }
00107 
00108     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00109     DataChunk & DataChunk::seek( size_t pos )
00110     {
00111         if( pos <= mSize )
00112             mPos = mData + pos;
00113 
00114         return *this;
00115     }
00116     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00117     DataChunk & DataChunk::skip( long offset )
00118     {
00119         size_t newpos = (size_t)( ( mPos - mData ) + offset );
00120         assert( mData <= mData + newpos && mData + newpos <= mEnd );        
00121 
00122         mPos = mData + newpos;
00123 
00124         return *this;
00125     }
00126     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00127     ulong DataChunk::readUpTo( void* buffer, size_t size, const char *delim )
00128     {
00129         size_t pos = strcspn((const char*)mPos, delim);
00130         if (pos > size)
00131             pos = size;
00132 
00133         if (pos > 0)
00134         {
00135             memcpy(buffer, (const void*)mPos, pos);
00136         }
00137         mPos += pos + 1;
00138 
00139         return static_cast< ulong >( pos );
00140     }
00141     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00142     bool DataChunk::isEOF(void)
00143     {
00144         if (mPos >= mEnd)
00145             return true;
00146         else
00147             return false;
00148 
00149     }
00150     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00151     String DataChunk::getLine(bool trimAfter)
00152     {
00153         static char buf[512]; // prevent continuous allocation / deallocation - not thread safe!
00154         int count;
00155 
00156         count = readUpTo(buf, 511);
00157         buf[count] = '\0';
00158         String ret = buf;
00159         if (trimAfter)
00160             ret.trim();
00161         return ret;
00162 
00163     }
00164 
00165 }
